Question.quest: Trinidad was colonized by which country before the english?
Question.fact: Before being under British rule, Trinidad was colonized by the spanish between 1498 and 1797

Question.quest: How many hills are there in San Fernando?
Question.fact: The Naparima Hill otherwise known as the San Fernando Hill is a 192-m Hill which lies at the centre of the city of San Fernando in Trinidad & Tobago

Question.quest: What is the number for the ambulance in Trinidad & Tobago?
Question.fact: To contact the Fire and Ambulance servcies dail 990

Question.quest: Who was the Prime Minister in 2004?
Question.fact: Former political leader of the People's National Movement (PNM) Patrick Augustus Mervyn Manning having terms from 17 December 1991 to 9 November 1995 and from 24 December 2001 to 26 May 2010

Question.quest: Who gave San Fernando its current city name?
Question.fact: The last spanosh governor of trinidad was Don Jose Maria Chacon. He was responsible for signing the cedula of population in 1783 and founding the city of San Fernando

Question.quest: Who is the first president of Tobago?
Question.fact: Ellis Emmanuel Innocent Clarke was the second and last Governor-General and was unamimously elected as president when Trinidad & Tobago became a Republic in 1976
